segment.name: Beginning of message
segment.documentation: BGM, A segment for unique identification of the Receiving advice message, name and its number.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, Date/time/period related to the whole message.

segment.name: Additional information
segment.documentation: ALI, A segment indicating that the message is subject to special conditions owing to origin or commercial factors.

segment.name: Currencies
segment.documentation: CUX, A segment to specify currencies and relevant details for the rate of exchange.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment to provide a clear or coded textual description of a reception rejection.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 1: A group of segments giving references where necessary, dates relating to the whole message, e.g. despatch advice, contract number, accounting citations, monetary amounts and allowance/charge information.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment for referencing documents relating to the whole Receiving advice message, e.g. despatch advice, purchase orders, delivery instructions. If the RECADV refers to a prior message, this message has to be referenced.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, Date or date and time as applied to the referred document.

segment.name: Processing information
segment.documentation: GEI, A segment identifying the components of an accounting citation.

segment.name: Monetary amount
segment.documentation: MOA, A segment providing a monetary amount related to an associated accounting citation.

segment.name: Allowance or charge
segment.documentation: ALC, A segment identifying the purpose of the accounting citation and indicating whether it is an allowance or a charge.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 2: A group of segments identifying the discrepancies with the documentary requirements relating to the whole consignment.

segment.name: Document/message details
segment.documentation: DOC, A segment identifying documents where a discrepancy occurs.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 3: A group of segments to report the physical or logical state of the document upon receipt and to give the appropriate instructions if needed.

segment.name: Physical or logical state
segment.documentation: CDI, A segment to report the logical state of the document upon receipt, e.g. required document not received or incorrect.

segment.name: Parties and instruction
segment.documentation: INP, A segment to give instructions to correct the discrepancy reflected by CDI segment, e.g. send again.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 4: A group of segments identifying names, addresses and locations, relevant to the whole Receiving advice.

segment.name: Name and address
segment.documentation: NAD, A segment for identifying names and addresses and their functions relevant for the whole Receiving advice. Identification of at least the recipient of the goods is mandatory. It is recommended that where possible only the coded form of the party ID should be specified.

segment.name: Place/location identification
segment.documentation: LOC, A segment indicating more details regarding specific places or locations related to the party specified in the NAD segment, e.g. internal site and, or building number.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 5: A group of segments giving references only relevant to the specified party rather than the whole message.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment for referencing documents relating to the party specified by the NAD segment.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment for date or date and time as related to the referred document.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 6: A group of segments giving contact details of the specific person or department within the party identified in the NAD segment.

segment.name: Contact information
segment.documentation: CTA, A segment to identify person, function, department to whom communication should be directed.

segment.name: Communication contact
segment.documentation: COM, A segment to identify communication types and numbers for person, function, department identified in CTA.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 7: A group of segments to report on discrepancies on terms of deliveries.

segment.name: Terms of delivery or transport
segment.documentation: TOD, A segment to indicate the terms of delivery.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 8: A group of segments to report on the discrepancy and to give the appropriate instructions, if needed.

segment.name: Physical or logical state
segment.documentation: CDI, A segment to report a discrepancy on the terms of delivery upon receipt.

segment.name: Parties and instruction
segment.documentation: INP, A segment to give instructions to correct the discrepancy reflected by CDI segment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 9: A group of segments to report discrepancy on locations related to terms of delivery.

segment.name: Place/location identification
segment.documentation: LOC, A segment indicating locations relevant to the TOD segment.

segment.name: Physical or logical state
segment.documentation: CDI, A segment to report discrepancy on locations.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 10: A group of segments specifying details of the mode and means of transport, the date or date and time of arrival, if a discrepancy has occurred or if required by the recipient of the message for further identification.

segment.name: Transport information
segment.documentation: TDT, A segment specifying the carriage, and the mode and means of transport of the goods arrived.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment giving the date or date and time information of the identified means of transport.

segment.name: Physical or logical state
segment.documentation: CDI, A segment to report the state of the mode and means of transport.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 11: A group of segments identifying equipment with which a problem has occurred or if required by the recipient of the message for further identification.

segment.name: Equipment details
segment.documentation: EQD, A segment to identify the specific equipment item.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 12: A segment group to report on the physical state of the identified equipment upon receipt and to give the appropriate instructions if needed.

segment.name: Physical or logical state
segment.documentation: CDI, A segment to report the physical state of the equipment upon receipt, e.g. damaged, missing.

segment.name: Parties and instruction
segment.documentation: INP, A segment to give instructions, e.g. pick up.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 13: A group of segments identifying the seal number and reporting anomalies.

segment.name: Seal number
segment.documentation: SEL, A segment specifying a seal number.

segment.name: Physical or logical state
segment.documentation: CDI, A segment identifying the anomaly reported.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 14: A group of segments identifying attached equipment with which a problem has occurred or if required by the recipient of the message for further identification.

segment.name: Attached equipment
segment.documentation: EQA, A segment identifying equipment attached to the equipment identified in the EQD segment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 15: A segment group to report the physical state of the identified attached equipment upon receipt and to give the appropriate instructions if needed.

segment.name: Physical or logical state
segment.documentation: CDI, A segment to report the physical state of the attached equipment upon receipt, e.g. damaged, missing.

segment.name: Parties and instruction
segment.documentation: INP, A segment to give instruction, e.g. pick up.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 16: A group of segments providing details of all packages and/or individual items as received. This segment group provides thecapability to give the top-down hierarchical relationship ofthe package levels and also of the transport levels.

segment.name: Consignment packing sequence
segment.documentation: CPS, A segment identifying the sequence in which packing of the consignment is presented, e.g. a pallet loaded with boxes.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 17: A group of segments giving references only relevant to the specified transport rather than the whole message.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment for referencing documents relating to the transport.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment for date or date and time as related to the referred document.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 18: A group of segments specifying details of the mode and means of transport, the date or date and time of departure and/or arrival.

segment.name: Transport information
segment.documentation: TDT, A segment specifying the carriage, and the mode and means oftransport of the goods arrived.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment giving the date or date and time information of the identified means of transport.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 19: A group of segments identifying names, addresses and locations,relevant to the delivery place by means of transport.

segment.name: Name and address
segment.documentation: NAD, A segment for identifying names and addresses of the party relevant to the delivery place by means of transport.

segment.name: Place/location identification
segment.documentation: LOC, A segment indicating more details regarding specific placesor locations related to the party specified in the name and address segment, e.g. internal site, building number.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 20: A group of segments identifying packaging, quantities and marks and numbers.

segment.name: Package
segment.documentation: PAC, A segment specifying the number and type of packages or physical units and the physical type of packaging of the arrived goods.

segment.name: Quantity variances
segment.documentation: QVR, A segment identifying quantity variances between the number of units received (as specified in the PAC segment) and the number of units expected or planned.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 21: A group of segments specifying markings and labels and, if required, related anomalies.

segment.name: Package identification
segment.documentation: PCI, A segment specifying markings and labels used on individual physical units (packages) described in the PAC segment.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment for referencing the package identification, e.g. master local number.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 22: A group of segments to report the physical state of the package upon receipt and to give the appropriate instructions if needed.

segment.name: Physical or logical state
segment.documentation: CDI, A segment to report the physical state of the related package, e.g. damaged, missing.

segment.name: Parties and instruction
segment.documentation: INP, A segment to give instructions, e.g. replace.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 23: A group of segments giving package identification numbers and if required the related anomalies.

segment.name: Goods identity number
segment.documentation: GIN, A segment providing identity numbers applied to packages being received or missing.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 24: A group of segments to report the physical state of the identified package upon receipt and to give the appropriate instructions if needed.

segment.name: Physical or logical state
segment.documentation: CDI, A segment to report the physical state of the identified package upon receipt, e.g. damaged, missing.

segment.name: Parties and instruction
segment.documentation: INP, A segment to give instructions, e.g. replace.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 25: SG29-SG31-SG33-SG34 A group of segments providing details of the product or service received.

segment.name: Line item
segment.documentation: LIN, A segment identifying the product or service received.

segment.name: Additional product id
segment.documentation: PIA, A segment providing additional product or service identification.

segment.name: Item description
segment.documentation: IMD, A segment describing the product or service received. This segment should be used for a product or service that cannot be identified by a product code or article number.

segment.name: Quantity
segment.documentation: QTY, A segment to give quantity information about the product specified in the LIN, PIA or IMD segment.

segment.name: Quantity variances
segment.documentation: QVR, A segment identifying quantity variances between quantity per item and quantity per item expected or planned.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment providing date or date and time information relevant for the delivery of product.

segment.name: Price details
segment.documentation: PRI, A segment to provide price information related to the current line item.

segment.name: Percentage details
segment.documentation: PCD, A segment to provide percentage information related to the current line item.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment to provide a clear or coded textual description of a reception rejection.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 26: A group of segments identifying names, addresses, locations andcontact information relevant to the line item.

segment.name: Name and address
segment.documentation: NAD, A segment to provide party information related to the line item.

segment.name: Place/location identification
segment.documentation: LOC, A segment indicating more details regarding specific placesor locations related to the party specified in the name and address segment, e.g. internal site, building number.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 27: A group of segments giving contact details of the specificperson or department within the party identified in the name and address segment.

segment.name: Contact information
segment.documentation: CTA, A segment to identify person, function, department to whom communication should be directed.

segment.name: Communication contact
segment.documentation: COM, A segment to identify communication types and numbers for person, function, department identified in the contact information segment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 28: A group of segments to report the physical state of the product given in the LIN or IMD segment upon receipt and to give the appropriate instructions if needed.

segment.name: Physical or logical state
segment.documentation: CDI, A segment to report the physical state of the product upon receipt e.g. wrong colour.

segment.name: Parties and instruction
segment.documentation: INP, A segment to give instructions, e.g. replace.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 29: A group of segments identifying the discrepancies with the documentary requirements relating to line item.

segment.name: Document/message details
segment.documentation: DOC, A segment identifying documents where a discrepancy occurs.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 30: A group of segments to report the physical or logical state of the document upon receipt and to give the appropriate instructions if needed.

segment.name: Physical or logical state
segment.documentation: CDI, A segment to report the physical or logical state of the document upon receipt, e.g. required documents not received or incorrect.

segment.name: Parties and instruction
segment.documentation: INP, A segment to give instructions, e.g. send again.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 31: A group of segments giving goods identification numbers and if required the related anomalies.

segment.name: Goods identity number
segment.documentation: GIN, A segment providing identity numbers of goods being received or missing.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 32: A group of segments to report the physical state of the identified goods at receipt and to give the appropriate instructions, if needed.

segment.name: Physical or logical state
segment.documentation: CDI, A segment to report the receiving conditions for the identified goods, e.g. missing, damaged.

segment.name: Parties and instruction
segment.documentation: INP, A segment to give instructions , e.g. replace.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 33: A group of segments giving references, dates, accounting citations, monetary amounts and allowance/charge information relevant to the line item.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment for referencing documents relating to the line item specified by the LIN or IMD segment.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment for date or date and time as related to the referred document.

segment.name: Processing information
segment.documentation: GEI, A segment identifying the components of an accounting citation.

segment.name: Monetary amount
segment.documentation: MOA, A segment providing a monetary amount related to an associated accounting citation.

segment.name: Allowance or charge
segment.documentation: ALC, A segment identifying the purpose of the accounting citation and indicating whether it is an allowance or a charge.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 34: A group of segments identifying one specific package or a number of packages, the marks and numbers, quantities, references and receiving conditions.

segment.name: Package identification
segment.documentation: PCI, A segment specifying marking and labels used on identified package(s).

segment.name: Quantity
segment.documentation: QTY, A segment to specify the quantity per package.

segment.name: Quantity variances
segment.documentation: QVR, A segment identifying quantity variances between quantity per package received and quantity per package expected or planned.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 35: A group of segments to report the physical state of the package upon receipt and to give the appropriate instructions, if needed.

segment.name: Physical or logical state
segment.documentation: CDI, A segment to report the physical state of the package, e.g. missing, damaged.

segment.name: Parties and instruction
segment.documentation: INP, A segment to give instructions, e.g. replace.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 36: A group of segments giving package identification numbers and if required the related anomalies.

segment.name: Goods identity number
segment.documentation: GIN, A segment providing identity numbers of packages received or missing.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 37: A group of segments to report the physical state of the identified packages upon receipt and to give the appropriate instructions, if needed.

segment.name: Physical or logical state
segment.documentation: CDI, A segment to report the physical state of the identified packages , e.g. missing, damaged.

segment.name: Parties and instruction
segment.documentation: INP, A segment to give instructions, e.g. replace.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 38: A group of segments giving references relevant to the specified package identified in the package identification segment.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment for referencing documents relating to the package.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment for date or date and time as related to the referred document.

segment.name: Control total
segment.documentation: CNT, A segment by which control total may be provided by sender for checking by the receiver.
